intro: Ebenus caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean broom, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ebenus caribaea is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil in coastal environments.
